transcripts.text: How's it going, sir?  How's it going?  Good.  Yeah, just checking up on you.  You've been sitting in the car here for like half an hour.  You live here?
Yes.  May I help you?
Yeah.  No, I'm just checking up.
Yes, this is my house right here.
Okay.  What's your name?
Why?
Well, you didn't come out of that house, though.  That's what I'm saying.  You came out of this house.
Your point, that's my neighbor.  Is there a problem with me going to my neighbor's house?
No, man.  Is there a problem with me talking to you?  Yes.  I don't like cops.
I'm black in America.  Why did you come in harassing me in front of my house?  This is my house.
You are harassing me.

I'm over here minding my business, writing a letter.  And you come over here and you're harassing me.  This is harassment.  I'm at my house doing my own.  I'm minding my business and you're here harassing me.  Searching my car right now.  You're searching my car with your eyes.  That's what you're doing, sir.  All right.
Well, it's a difference between looking somewhere and searching your car.  I'm not searching your car.
So you're telling me if you see something in my car, you're not going to try to search my car further and do more investigation?
If I see something illegal in your car, obviously I am.  That's not a search of your car, sir.  I'm not searching your car.

I would appreciate if you stop harassing me, sir.  I don't know you.  You don't know me.  You saw me over here sitting in my vehicle at my house.  This is my house.  This is my neighbor's house.  My car's been sitting here all night.  You're doing an investigation?  All you have to do is watch.  Just keep watching.  I'm not doing nothing illegal.  That's fine.  Good.  All right.  Um... Okay.
I hope you have a great day.  I hope you do too, sir.
I'm just trying to mind my business and be sitting in my car and enjoy the sun.  It's rare that days are like that.
So this is your car?
What does that matter?
Because you just said I'm trying to mind my business and sit in my car.
Okay, I have possession of the car right now.  I'm sitting in it.  This is my car right now.  I have possession.  It's 910 to the law.  I'd appreciate it if you leave me alone.
All right, sir.
Thank you very much, sir.  Have a great day.  You too.  What was his name again?
Officer Jenkins.  Officer Jenkins?  Yes, sir.  Brian Jenkins.  Okay.  Okay.  Have a great day.
